intro: Corsia torricellensis, commonly known as the Torricelli corsia, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Corsia torricellensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
